TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Header/ItemLeft extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the leftmost item of the header control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Header.ItemLeft class gets a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the leftmost header item.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Header.ItemLeft.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItemLeft1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#169](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_44_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#169](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_44_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the leftmost header item in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents the leftmost header item in the hot state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Hot property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItemLeft2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#170](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_21_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#170](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_21_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the leftmost header item in the normal state.
Docs.value: A that represents the leftmost header item in the normal state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItemLeft1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#169](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_113_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#169](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_113_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the leftmost header item in the pressed state.
Docs.value: A that represents the leftmost header item in the pressed state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Pressed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementHeaderItemLeft3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
